conclusion: Analysis of object interactions due to gravity
Scene with various objects on a table surface; labeled points A through F showing different objects and materials
Determine what happens when objects A and B move through the air and are placed at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F, considering gravity's effects
Object A appears to be a light blue textured fabric/cloth
Object B appears to be a patterned fabric with zigzag/chevron pattern
Object C is an orange cubic block
Object D is a green rectangular block
Object E appears to be a brown cubic block
Object F appears to be a gray cubic block
Objects C, D, E, and F are solid blocks sitting on the table surface
Objects A and B are fabrics/cloths that in later images are shown draping over the blocks
When fabric is placed over solid objects, gravity pulls the fabric downward
The fabric will conform to the shape of the objects beneath it
Where there is no support, the fabric will drape downward
When fabric A is placed at the locations of objects C and D, it will drape over the cubic/rectangular blocks
Fabric A will conform to the shapes of objects C and D, creating raised areas where the blocks are
Between and around objects C and D, fabric A will hang down due to gravity
When fabric B is placed at the locations of objects E and F, it will drape over these blocks
Fabric B will take on the general shape of objects E and F underneath
The unsupported areas of fabric B will hang down
The third image shows both fabrics placed over their respective blocks, conforming to the shapes beneath them
Colored pins are holding parts of the fabric in place
Objects A and B will make contact with the top surfaces of objects C, D, E, and F
